intro: Argylia reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined argylia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with a distinctive network of veins, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Argylia reticulatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
